intro: Cyrtandra oxybapha, commonly known as the white-flowered cyrtandra, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Papua New Guinea. This plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are characterized by their white petals and prominent yellow stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
